intro: Erigeron alpicola var. haruoi, commonly known as the alpine fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy ray florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found at high elevations and is adapted to cold, harsh climatic conditions.
